dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1490 IH: TRIO Access Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Moore of Wisconsin (for herself, Ms. Tenney, Ms. Bonamici, and Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Education and Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow certain return information disclosed to institutions of higher education for financial aid purposes to also be used for certain Federal TRIO programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the TRIO Access Act.

section.header: Certain return information disclosed to institutions of higher education for financial aid purposes also allowed to be used for certain Federal TRIO programs
section.text: Section 6103(l)(13)(D) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: Return information received pursuant to clause (iii)(I) may be used by the institution of higher education referred to in such clause for the purposes of the programs authorized under sections 402D and 402E of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a–14 and 1070a–15; relating to student support services and the Ronald E. McNair Post-Baccalaureate Achievement Program), as in effect on the date of the enactment of this clause.

section.header: Conforming amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965

subsection.text: Section 483(a)(2)(D)(i) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1090(a)(2)(D)(i)) is amended by striking to disclose to an institution and inserting to disclose to an institution for purposes of a program authorized under section 402D or 402E, and to disclose to an institution.

subsection.header: Use of information provided to the institution
subsection.text: Section 483(a)(3)(C)(i) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1090(a)(3)(C)(i)) is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: shall use the information provided to the institution solely—

subclause.text: for the application, award, and administration of financial aid to the applicant; and
for purposes of a program authorized under section 402D or 402E;

subsection.header: Notification and Approval Requirements for requesting tax return information
subsection.text: Section 494(a)(1)(A) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1098h(a)(1)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i)(II), by striking (v), and (vi) and inserting (v), (vi), and (vii); and

in clause (ii), by inserting and an institution of higher education being unable to determine the eligibility of such individual for a program authorized under section 402D or 402E before the semicolon.
